sentences.english: He was approaching the inglorious twilight of his career.
sentences.chinese: 他正接近自己的生涯中湮没无闻的隐晦时期。

sentences.english: He was written off as a has-been.
sentences.chinese: 作为曾经是红极一时的人物，他现已湮没无闻。

sentences.english: Dickinson's name remained in eclipse for many years after her death.
sentences.chinese: 迪金森死后很多年，她的名字一直都湮没无闻。

sentences.english: After the Han Dynasty, Mohism fell into oblivion.
sentences.chinese: 墨家在汉代以后湮没无闻。

sentences.english: His linguistic work presented much data on languages which would otherwise have been little known.
sentences.chinese: 若非他的语言学着作，众多语言资料仍湮没无闻。

sentences.english: Most of his inventions have been consigned to oblivion.
sentences.chinese: 他的大部份发明都湮没无闻了。

sentences.english: That ancient city has been buried in oblivion.
sentences.chinese: 那座古城早已湮没无闻。

sentences.english: Many subject engaged the attention of the best mathematicians ultimately faded into oblivion.
sentences.chinese: 许多科目得到最好的数学家的注意，但终于湮没无闻。

definition: to bury/to submerge/to pass into oblivion/to obliterate/to annihilate (physics)
to sink into oblivion/to be lost to memory/to vanish
to enjoy a short-lived fame or position of power
to write a book advancing one's theory (idiom)
to add parallels and interpretations (to a story etc)/to develop and embellish/to interpret (often in a strained manner)
rare as morning stars (idiom)/few and far between/sparse
to decline/to die out/decline and fall
lit. abandoned by men and choked with weeds/desolate (idiom)
